byline.contributor: Anthony Shadid and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting.

snippet: More than the popular protests, Western sanctions have threatened President Bashar al-Assad’s government, which relies on its economic successes as a source of its legitimacy.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: More than the popular protests, Western sanctions have threatened President Bashar al-Assad’s government, which relies on its economic successes as a source of its legitimacy.

headline.main: Sanctions Pose Growing Threat to Syria’s Assad
headline.print_headline: Sanctions Pose Growing Threat To Syrian Chief
headline.seo: President Assad of Syria Is Threatened by Faltering Economy
